quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Character and Words
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, john, spies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This character, known for roaming the depths of the sea in his submarine, the Nautilus, dies saying God and my country!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Captain Nemo

questions.question: This spy for the Soviet Union worked as a journalist in both Germany and Japan during WWII.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Sorge

questions.question: Bella Boyd was a confederate spy in the American Civil War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Im cold were the last words uttered by this Catch-22 character after he was mortally injured by antiaircraft fire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snowden

questions.question: John Andre was a French officer hanged as a spy during the American Revolutionary War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: These were the last words spoken by Oscar Wildes character Dorian Grey, before the servants found his body, stabbed in the heart and suddenly aged.

options.text: Me. . .Ethan. . .All of the unclaimed. . .Dont let it happen again.
Thanks. Youve been my friend, Garraty... another time, another place.
Very well. I shall be here at eleven. Good night, Harry.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Very well. I shall be here at eleven. Good night, Harry.

questions.question: The horror! The horror! were the last words of this character from Joseph Conrads novel Heart of Darkness.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Kurz

questions.question: This character from the Harry Potter series said Come on, you can do better than that! after Bellatrix Lestrange fired a curse at him and missed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sirius Black

questions.question: A horse, a horse, my kingdom for a horse! shouts this Shakespearean character before being killed by Richmond in the final duel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard III

questions.question: This captain during the American Revolutionary War is widely considered to be America’s first spy. Before being hanged he said “I only regret that I have but one life to lose for my country”.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nathan Hale

questions.question: Bad form, said this character and fell into the jaws of a crocodile after being kicked by the boy who wouldnt grow up.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Captain Hook

questions.question: In what Ernest Hemingway novel does nurse Catherine Barkley say Dont worry, darling. Im not a bit afraid. Its just a dirty trick before dying during childbirth?

options.text: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Farewell to Arms

questions.question: The Cambridge Five was a ring of Soviet spies based in the UK.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This character, depicted by Mario Puzo in a famous crime novel, dies of a heart attack while playing with his grandson. His last words are Life is so beautiful.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vito Corleone

questions.question: This young, mysterious millionaire, later revealed to be a bootlegger, said, Well, good-by before being shot by George Wilson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jay Gatsby

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Title and Norman Birdwell
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, rangers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What big red dog, created in 1963 by Norman Birdwell, is owned by Emily Elizabeth Howard?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clifford

questions.question: Which of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles wears a red mask and red cloth around his knees?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raphael

questions.question: Complete the title of this 1983 song by Prince:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corvette

questions.question: Which of these countries does NOT touch the Red Sea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iraq

questions.question: What little girl had to face The Red Room in the second chapter of a famous novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Eyre

questions.question: Why were red MMs banned from 1976 to 1986?

options.text: It was randomly chosen because Mars Inc. needed to reduce production of one color due to a market decline.
They were voted to be taken out.
They didnt go well with the color scheme of a new brand.
The amaranth dye was thought to be a carcinogen.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The amaranth dye was thought to be a carcinogen.

questions.question: Are both the solid red ball and the striped red ball in pool on odd numbers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Which of these is NOT true about these movies?

options.text: In the 2002 Tamil film Red, Red stands for Revolution, Education, Development.
In the 2010 film RED, starring Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman and Helen Mirren, RED stands for Retired, Extremely Dangerous.
In the 1984 movie Reds, directed and produced by Warren Beatty, the Reds are members of the American Communist Party.
In the 2008 film Red, starring Brian Cox, Red is the nickname of the main characters wife.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the 2008 film Red, starring Brian Cox, Red is the nickname of the main characters wife.

questions.question: How many red coins did Mario have to collect in Super Mario 64 in order to gain a star?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8

questions.question: Which one of the 4 original male power rangers was the Red Ranger?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jason Lee Scott

questions.question: Which of the original Pac-Man ghosts is red?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blinky

questions.question: The Second Red Scare, which dealt with negative communistic influence in the U.S., was spurred by  former Wisconsin senator Joseph McCarthy after which war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: WWII

questions.question: Which of these pigments is dominantly found in red hair?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: pheomelanin

questions.question: Which colour of the rainbow comes immediately after red?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: orange

questions.question: Do the red candy in the original Skilttles and the original Starburst in the red wrapper have the same flavor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Atlantis and Novel
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, fiction, descendants. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: New Atlantis is a novel by Sir Francis Bacon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The possible existence of Atlantis was never discussed throughout classical antiquity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who thought that Atlantis was a naval power lying in front of the Pillars of Hercules and that it sank into the ocean in a single day and night of misfortune.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Plato

questions.question: Which of the following movies makes references to Atlantis?

options.text: Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis (1992)
Journey to the Center of the Earth (1959)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of the planets in the solar system has a storm on it that scientists have dubbed the Big Red Spot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jupiter

questions.question: Jules Verne wrote the science fiction novel The Maracot Deep which describes the discovery of the sunken remains of Atlantis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In his work The Chronology of the Ancient Kingdoms Amended this scholar studied a variety of mythological links to Atlantis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isaak Newton

questions.question: Reichsführer-SS Heinrich Himmler organized a German expedition to Tibet to search for Aryan Atlanteans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In hospitals, what does a code red usually signify?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fire

questions.question: What Greek philosopher mentioned Atlantis for the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Plato

questions.question: The Cincinnati Reds were once called the Cincinnati Red Stockings. The Red Sox, with a name (Sox) thats a plural of sock, is from what U.S. city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston

questions.question: Are the Washington Redskins, an NFL team, closer to Washington state than they are to Washington D.C.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Does hemoglobin make red blood cells red?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What Swedish scholar published the book Atland in several volumes, starting in 1679?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Olaus Rudbeck

questions.question: Theosophists consider themselves spiritual and even genetic descendants of the inhabitants of the lost Atlantis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Dalmatians
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, cruella, evans. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the movie High School Musical, Taylor is portrayed by Raven Symone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the name of Sharpays twin brother in the movie High School Musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ryan

questions.question: Is the Evans dog in High School Musical played by the movie directors dog?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: In the movie One Hundred and One Dalmatians, what does Cruella do to convince the Dearlys that shes innocent of the kidnapping?

options.text: Drives around Regents Park looking for them
Calls them to console with them
Writes them a letter expressing her sorrow for them
Comes over to their house to console them for their loss

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calls them to console with them

questions.question: In the animated film One Hundred and One Dalmatians, what distracts the Baduns long enough to allow Sergeant Tibbs to flee with the puppies?

options.text: A television show called Whats My Crime
A video game called Whats My Crime
A board game called Whats My Crime
A radio chat segment called Whats My Crime

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A television show called Whats My Crime

questions.question: In the movie One Hundred and One Dalmatians, who goes into Hell Hall in order to rescue the puppies before Pongo and Perdita arrive there?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sergeant Tibbs

questions.question: In the first High School Musical movie, is the final basketball game interrupted?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What is the name of the main antagonist/villainess in the animated feature One Hundred and One Dalmatians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cruella

questions.question: How many Dalmatian puppies were stolen by Cruella, Jasper and Horace in the movie One Hundred and One Dalmatians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15

questions.question: In what month were Pongo and Perditas 15 puppies born in the animated film One Hundred and One Dalmatians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: October

questions.question: A character in the movie High School Musical is named Sharpay. Is there a dog breed with the same name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: In High School Musical, Troys father is the coach of the East High football team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these was the only trick that succeeded in completely eluding Jasper, Horace, and Cruella in the movie One Hundred and One Dalmatians?

options.text: Sergeant Tibbs escape through the hole in the wall
Pongo disguising the Dalmatians as Labradors
Pongo erasing the pawprints from the road
The puppies hiding under the bridge

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The puppies hiding under the bridge

questions.question: In what country does the movie One Hundred and One Dalmatians take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Britain

questions.question: In the movie One Hundred and One Dalmatians, what is the occupation of Pongos owner Roger Radcliffe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: songwriter

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Words and Man
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, holbrooke, producers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This man gave us Tom Thumb and Jumbo the Elephant . His last words were: How were the receipts at Madison Square Garden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: P.T. Barnum

questions.question: Where do Troy and Gabriela first meet in the movie High School Musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: at a ski lodge

questions.question: Although he was never President, this man had a great influence on American history. His last words were A dying man can do nothing easy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ben Franklin

questions.question: What were the last words of Richard Holbrooke, a top level US diplomat?

options.text: We must bomb Cuba out of existence.
We must get our troops out of San Marino.
We should back the Bolivians in the Falklands War.
Weve got to stop this war in Afghanistan.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Weve got to stop this war in Afghanistan.

questions.question: What film studio cancelled Elizabeth Taylors contract after its production chief stated that She cant sing, she cant dance, she cant perform.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Universal

questions.question: While he was driving his car down a California highway, this star said : This guys got to stop...hell see us.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Dean

questions.question: What statement regarding Elizabeth Taylors marriages is NOT correct?

options.text: She was married eight times to seven husbands.
All her marriages ended in divorce.
She had four children with three different husbands.
She married twice one and the same person.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All her marriages ended in divorce.

questions.question: Which great minds last words were: I have offended God and mankind because my work did not reach the quality it should.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonardo Da Vinci

questions.question: Elizabeth Rosemond Taylor was born in 1932 in a wealthy district of this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: London

questions.question: It is very beautiful over there. were the last words of this famous American. I hope a light bulb goes on and your phonograph is off when you get the  answer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Alva Edison

questions.question: He was one of the great show producers in America. His last words were: Curtain! Fast music! Light! Ready for the last finale! Great! The show looks  good, the show looks good!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flo Ziegfeld

questions.question: Her last radio message was KHAQQ calling Itasca. We must be on you. Gas is running low.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amelia Earhart

questions.question: Id hate to die twice. It is so boring. were the last words of this great scientist, famous for finding the cause of the Challenger tragedy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Feynman

questions.question: What 1950 comedy movie starring Elizabeth Taylor, Spencer Tracy and Joan Bennett was remade in 1991?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Father of the Bride

questions.question: His nine symphonies are still studied and played today. His last words were Friends applaud, the comedy is finished.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beethoven

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Words and Elizabeth Taylor
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Elizabeth Taylor played the passionate, sexually-frustrated Maggie in the movie Cat On A Hot Tin Roof. Who wrote the Pulitzer Prize-wining play on which the movie is based?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tennessee Williams

questions.question: What famous pearl did Richard Burton purchase in 1969 as a Valentines Day present for his then-wife Elizabeth Taylor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Peregrina

questions.question: What 1960 movie stars Elizabeth Taylor as a fashion model and party girl who lives a wild and promiscuous life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: BUtterfield 8

questions.question: There are no other worlds to conquer were the last words of this great leader as he finished his conquests from Macedonia through what is now  Pakistan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander the Great

questions.question: Get my swan costume ready were the last words, not of Natalie Portman but of this great dancer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anna Pavlova

questions.question: He was one of Americas greatest dramatists. His daughter, Oona, married Charlie Chaplin. His last words were: I knew it! I knew it! Born in a hotel room and damn it, died in a hotel room.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eugene ONeil

questions.question: Lets cool it brothers were his last words, not those of Denzel Washington.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malcolm X

questions.question: When a priest asked him to denounce the Devil, the last words of this leader of the French Enlightenment were: This is no time to make new enemies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Voltaire

questions.question: He was an American writer who was born in Fresno, California. He wrote the song Come on to My House with his cousin Ross Bagdarian of Chipmunk fame. He also wrote Golden Boy and The Time of  Your Life. His last words were Everybodys got to die, but I have always believed an exception would be made in my case. Now what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Saroyan

questions.question: Relax, this wont hurt. were the last words of this inventor of Gonzo journalism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hunter Thompson

questions.question: Elizabeth Taylor gained 30 pounds (13.5kg) for the role of the frumpy, hard-drinking Martha and her performance earned her an Academy Award for Best Actress. Name the movie in which Marthas husband was portrayed by Taylors then-husband Richard Burton.

options.text: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whos Afraid of Virginia Woolf?

questions.question: Elizabeth Taylor was awarded a record-setting contract of $1 million for playing the leading female role in this movie which nearly bankrupted 20th Century Fox?

options.text: The Last Time I Saw Paris

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleopatra

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a perfume launched by Elizabeth Taylor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Midnight Poison

questions.question: Kill me now or you are a murderer. were the last words of this great writer from Prague.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franz Kafka

questions.question: This philosophers last words were not his Manifesto but Go on get out. Last words are for fools who havent said enough. Who was this writing partner of Engels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karl Marx
